text:
The request from browser to proxy server :

GET http://www.yahoo.com/ HTTP/1.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-us
UA-CPU: x86
Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.2; SV1; .NET CLR
1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; FDM)
Host: www.yahoo.com
Cookie: B=abu35ml1u4qdm&b=3&s=f8;
LYC=l_v=2&l_lv=9&l_l=380d0_i70hael0&l_s=5wsxwxwys05yu3ux111y35qtv4z3x4sx&l_lid=14kt9rr&l_r=8t&l_um=0_0_1_0_0


HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Date: Thu, 16 Feb 2006 05:46:12 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1
Connection: close

The Request from proxy server to www.yahoo.com :

UA-CPU: x86

1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; FDM)

LYC=l_v=2&l_lv=9&l_l=380d0_i70hael0&l_s=5wsxwxwys05yu3ux111y35qtv4z3x4sx&l_lid=14kt9rr&l_r=8t&l_um=0_0_1_0_0
Max-Forwards: 10
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: www.yahoo.com
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-us
UA-CPU: x86
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.2; SV1; .NET CLR
1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; FDM)
Cookie: B=abu35ml1u4qdm&b=3&s=f8;
LYC=l_v=2&l_lv=9&l_l=380d0_i70hael0&l_s=5wsxwxwys05yu3ux111y35qtv4z3x4sx&l_lid=14kt9rr&l_r=8t&l_um=0_0_1_0_0
Max-Forwards: 10


HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Date: Thu, 16 Feb 2006 05:46:08 GMT
Connection: close
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1

Obviously when running with mod_proxy, Apache doubles the request.

Loaded modules are :

LoadModule access_module modules/mod_access.so
LoadModule actions_module modules/mod_actions.so
LoadModule alias_module modules/mod_alias.so
LoadModule asis_module modules/mod_asis.so
LoadModule auth_module modules/mod_auth.so
LoadModule autoindex_module modules/mod_autoindex.so
LoadModule cgi_module modules/mod_cgi.so
LoadModule dir_module modules/mod_dir.so
LoadModule env_module modules/mod_env.so
LoadModule imap_module modules/mod_imap.so
LoadModule include_module modules/mod_include.so
LoadModule isapi_module modules/mod_isapi.so
LoadModule log_config_module modules/mod_log_config.so
LoadModule mime_module modules/mod_mime.so
LoadModule proxy_module modules/mod_proxy.so
LoadModule proxy_http_module modules/mod_proxy_http.so
LoadModule negotiation_module modules/mod_negotiation.so
LoadModule rewrite_module modules/mod_rewrite.so
LoadModule setenvif_module modules/mod_setenvif.so
LoadModule userdir_module modules/mod_userdir.so
LoadModule ssl_module modules/mod_ssl.so
LoadModule php5_module D:/languages/php/5.1.2/php5apache2.dll


Other specific settings :

Listen 7432

NameVirtualHost 192.168.0.21:7432
NameVirtualHost 127.0.0.1:7432

<VirtualHost 192.168.0.21:7432 127.0.0.1:7432>
	ProxyRequests On
	ProxyVia On
	<Proxy *>
		Allow from all
		Order allow,deny
	</Proxy>
</VirtualHost>

This behavior is same on Apache 2.0.54 2.0.55 (and may be earlier versions)
under Windows 2003 Web Edition SP1 and Windows XP SP2
creator: radkosharkov@gmail.com

text:
Do you still have a problem with Apache 2.2?  If not, we can close this.

What did you use to capture this trace information?  And where did you sniff it?
 Within the proxy, or on the same machine, or on the backend, or somewhere
between them on the network?
creator: nick@webthing.com

text:
Hello Nick,

   Let me try to answer all your questions. 

I did not found how to fix this problem and it stays remaining even in
Apache/2.0.59, which I currently use.

To sniff the HTTP traffic I used a Smart Sniff v1.11 utility
(http://www.nirsoft.net/), and for particulary this communication It was
deployed on same machine with the Firefox web browser and Apache HTTP server,
which I tried to use as HTTP Proxy. I tried to run proxy on the internal machine
(192.168.x.x) and on machine with real IP address - but the result was the same.
Something like "Unknown or malformed header - GET / HTTP/1.1". If you are
interested in, we can share a Remote Desktop session on my PC in order to help
you solve this problem.

Best Regards,
Radko
creator: radkosharkov@gmail.com

text:
2.0.61 and 2.2.6 are current; within the week you should be able to obtain
the new 2.0.62/2.2.7 and verify if the issue remains or is resolved.

Will leave this open a while for feedback.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text: As per last comment, assuming fixed.
creator: nick@webthing.com
